Hello families:

Earlier today, the State Board of Education adopted a Back to School Framework for Idaho schools – a 46 page document which was prepared by a Governor’s committee that included representation from public schools throughout Idaho.

The framework provides guidance for all aspects of public education but still leaves control at the local level. We continue to monitor the local conditions and level of community transmission as those factors will be significant in our preparations for students to return to the classroom. The School Board, administrative team and other various groups will study the plan in great detail and will be working diligently to digest this new information, define a plan that fits our district and schools specifically. More information will be forthcoming over the next few weeks.

Good afternoon community,

We know it has been a little while since we have done an update and that is because it has been a blessedly quiet few weeks for COVID-19 here on the reservation.

We currently have 3 cases on the reservation right now and those 3 individuals are the only individuals who are being quarantined at this time.

As we head into the summer months and especially with the holiday weekend next week, please remember to practice social distancing.

Our numbers here on the reservation are looking good, but in Coeur d’Alene, Spokane, and many other places around the country, the numbers are going up again.

We all wish COVID-19 would just disappear already, but in reality, it will be with us for the foreseeable future.

Don’t let your guard down – make sure you are protecting yourself and your family while you are out and about this weekend and in the coming weeks and months!

Lim Lemtsh

April 6, 2020
The Idaho State Board of Education voted today to extend the “soft closure” of all public schools to the end of this school year, or until local and state social distancing orders have been lifted by authorities.
The “soft closure” means that we can’t provide instruction in school buildings because of the COVID-19 pandemic. We are allowed to enact the remote learning and educational packets being put in place, and we will continue to deliver meals. School staff is prepared to continue teaching our students remotely through the end of this school year if necessary. Please follow all learning directions provided by Mr. Mitchell and Mrs. Hall.

The district and your school board are paying close attention to the situation. We miss your kids and want them back in school as soon as it is safe. Be healthy! Be safe!

As the fun and excitement of the holiday season winds down, it is easy to forget the safety lessons children learned in the Fall. Before your kids head back to school, review these winter school bus safety tips with them and share this post to remind others of the importance of #schoolbussafety.

+ Arrive early to the bus stop and dress appropriately for the weather (heavy jackets, hats, mittens, gloves or boots!)

+ Students should wait for the bus several feet further back off the road in a safe place. The roads can be slippery.

+Use the handrail when boarding and exiting the bus to prevent slips and falls on icy steps.

+ Before crossing in front of the bus, wait for an “all clear” from the driver. Cross 10 feet in front of the bus so the driver can see you as you cross.
